1.text: Place 4 stones into each of the 12 cups.

2.text: Pick up the stones from 1 of your cups on your turn.

3.text: Place 1 stone into each of the cups to the right of that cup.

4.text: Take turns to continue playing the game.

5.text: End the game when all the cups on 1 side of the board are empty.

6.text: Count your stones to see who has the most.

7.text: Note that there will still be stones on the board when the game is over.

8.text: Identify a move that would end on an empty cup on your side.

9.text: Place 1 stone into each space going counter-clockwise.

10.text: Collect the stones in your opponent’s cup across from your cup.

11.text: Place your opponent’s stones and your stone into your mancala.

12.text: Determine if you will be playing by Wari rules before you start.

13.text: Look for cups that have 1 or 2 stones and target those cups.

14.text: Collect stones from the cup that you end on if it has 2 to 3 stones.

15.text: Gather the stones in previous cups if they also have 2 to 3.
